p: Field investigations were managed by the Agence Nationale de Sécurité Sanitaire (ANSS) in consultation with members of the Ministry of Health, the Gamal-Nasser University of Conakry, the Word Health Organization (WHO), the NGO Médecins sans Frontières (MSF) and the Centre of Disease Control (CDC). A first investigation took place 6–7 February 2019 in the prefecture of Kissidougou where the patient lived. A second investigation took place 6–7 February 2019 in the Mamou prefecture where the patient died ( Figure 1). Contacts in health centres and hospitals were identified and their blood was collected for PCR testing. The tests were carried out in the laboratory on 31 January 2019 for the patient and from 8 to 9 February 2019 for the contacts ( Table S1). All subjects and the family of the deceased patient gave their informed consent. The protocol has been approved by the Ethics Committee for Health Research in Guinea (permit n°129/CNERS/16, approval 11 October 2016).
